00035 
00036     template <class ValueType, class TriggerEntryType>
00037     struct sorted_runs
00038     {
00039         typedef TriggerEntryType trigger_entry_type;
00040         typedef ValueType value_type;
00041         typedef typename trigger_entry_type::bid_type bid_type;
00042         typedef stxxl::int64 size_type;
00043         typedef std::vector<trigger_entry_type> run_type;
00044         typedef typed_block<bid_type::size, value_type> block_type;
00045         size_type elements;
00046         std::vector<run_type> runs;
00047         std::vector<unsigned_type> runs_sizes;
00048 
00049         // Optimization:
00050         // if the input is small such that its total size is
00051         // less than B (block_type::size)
00052         // then input is sorted internally
00053         // and kept in the array "small"
00054         std::vector<ValueType> small_;
00055 
00056         sorted_runs() : elements(0) { }
00057 
00062         void deallocate_blocks()
00063         {
00064             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00065             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < runs.size(); ++i)
00066                 bm->delete_blocks(
00067                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(runs[i].begin()),
00068                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(runs[i].end()));
00069 
00070 
00071             runs.clear();
00072         }
00073     };
00074 
00082     template <
00083         class Input_,
00084         class Cmp_,
00085         unsigned BlockSize_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(typename Input_::value_type),
00086         class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY>
00087     class runs_creator : private noncopyable
00088     {
00089         Input_ & input;
00090         Cmp_ cmp;
00091 
00092     public:
00093         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00094         typedef typename Input_::value_type value_type;
00095         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00096         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00097         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00098         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00099 
00100     private:
00101         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00102         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00103         unsigned_type m_;         // memory for internal use in blocks
00104         bool result_computed;     // true result is already computed (used in 'result' method)
00105 
00106         void compute_result();
00107         void sort_run(block_type * run, unsigned_type elements)
00108         {
00109             if (block_type::has_filler)
00110                 std::sort(
00111 #if 1
00112                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00113                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00114                         >(run, 0),
00115                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00116                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00117                         >(run, elements),
00118 #else
00119                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00120                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00121                         >(run, 0),
00122                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00123                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00124                         >(run, elements),
00125 #endif
00126                     cmp);
00127 
00128             else
00129                 std::sort(run[0].elem, run[0].elem + elements, cmp);
00130         }
00131 
00132     public:
00137         runs_creator(Input_ & i, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00138             input(i), cmp(c), m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()), result_computed(false)
00139         {
00140             assert(2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00141         }
00142 
00146         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00147         {
00148             if (!result_computed)
00149             {
00150                 compute_result();
00151                 result_computed = true;
00152 #ifdef STXXL_PRINT_STAT_AFTER_RF
00153                 STXXL_MSG(*stats::get_instance());
00154 #endif
00155             }
00156             return result_;
00157         }
00158     };
00159 
00160 
00161     template <class Input_, class Cmp_, unsigned BlockSize_, class AllocStr_>
00162     void runs_creator<Input_, Cmp_, BlockSize_, AllocStr_>::compute_result()
00163     {
00164         unsigned_type i = 0;
00165         unsigned_type m2 = m_ / 2;
00166         const unsigned_type el_in_run = m2 * block_type::size; // # el in a run
00167         STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator::compute_result m2=" << m2);
00168         unsigned_type pos = 0;
00169 
00170 #ifndef STXXL_SMALL_INPUT_PSORT_OPT
00171         block_type * Blocks1 = new block_type[m2 * 2];
00172 #else
00173 #if 0
00174         block_type * Blocks1 = new block_type[1];          // allocate only one block first
00175                                                            // if needed reallocate
00176         while (!input.empty() && pos != block_type::size)
00177         {
00178             Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00179             ++input;
00180             ++pos;
00181         }
00182 #endif
00183 
00184         while (!input.empty() && pos != block_type::size)
00185         {
00186             result_.small_.push_back(*input);
00187             ++input;
00188             ++pos;
00189         }
00190 
00191         block_type * Blocks1;
00192 
00193         if (pos == block_type::size)
00194         {   // enlarge/reallocate Blocks1 array
00195             block_type * NewBlocks = new block_type[m2 * 2];
00196             std::copy(result_.small_.begin(), result_.small_.end(), NewBlocks[0].begin());
00197             result_.small_.clear();
00198             //delete [] Blocks1;
00199             Blocks1 = NewBlocks;
00200         }
00201         else
00202         {
00203             STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator: Small input optimization, input length: " << pos);
00204             result_.elements = pos;
00205             std::sort(result_.small_.begin(), result_.small_.end(), cmp);
00206             return;
00207         }
00208 #endif
00209 
00210         while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00211         {
00212             Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00213             ++input;
00214             ++pos;
00215         }
00216 
00217         // sort first run
00218         sort_run(Blocks1, pos);
00219         result_.elements = pos;
00220         if (pos < block_type::size && input.empty()) // small input, do not flush it on the disk(s)
00221         {
00222             STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator: Small input optimization, input length: " << pos);
00223             result_.small_.resize(pos);
00224             std::copy(Blocks1[0].begin(), Blocks1[0].begin() + pos, result_.small_.begin());
00225             delete[] Blocks1;
00226             return;
00227         }
00228 
00229 
00230         block_type * Blocks2 = Blocks1 + m2;
00231         block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00232         request_ptr * write_reqs = new request_ptr[m2];
00233         run_type run;
00234 
00235 
00236         unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00237         run.resize(cur_run_size);
00238         bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00239                        trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00240                        trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00241                        );
00242 
00243         disk_queues::get_instance()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00244 
00245         result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00246 
00247         // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00248         for ( ; pos != el_in_run; ++pos)
00249             Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00250 
00251 
00252         for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00253         {
00254             run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00255             write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00256             //STXXL_MSG("BID: "<<run[i].bid<<" val: "<<run[i].value);
00257         }
00258         result_.runs.push_back(run); // #
00259 
00260         if (input.empty())
00261         {
00262             // return
00263             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + cur_run_size);
00264             delete[] write_reqs;
00265             delete[] Blocks1;
00266             return;
00267         }
00268 
00269         STXXL_VERBOSE1("Filling the second part of the allocated blocks");
00270         pos = 0;
00271         while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00272         {
00273             Blocks2[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00274             ++input;
00275             ++pos;
00276         }
00277         result_.elements += pos;
00278 
00279         if (input.empty())
00280         {
00281             // (re)sort internally and return
00282             pos += el_in_run;
00283             sort_run(Blocks1, pos); // sort first an second run together
00284             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + cur_run_size);
00285             bm->delete_blocks(trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00286                               trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end()));
00287 
00288             cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size);
00289             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00290             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00291                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00292                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00293                            );
00294 
00295             result_.runs_sizes[0] = pos;
00296             // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00297             for ( ; pos != 2 * el_in_run; ++pos)
00298                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00299 
00300 
00301             assert(cur_run_size > m2);
00302 
00303             for (i = 0; i < m2; ++i)
00304             {
00305                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00306                 write_reqs[i]->wait();
00307                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00308             }
00309 
00310             request_ptr * write_reqs1 = new request_ptr[cur_run_size - m2];
00311 
00312             for ( ; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00313             {
00314                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00315                 write_reqs1[i - m2] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00316             }
00317 
00318             result_.runs[0] = run;
00319 
00320             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + m2);
00321             delete[] write_reqs;
00322             wait_all(write_reqs1, write_reqs1 + cur_run_size - m2);
00323             delete[] write_reqs1;
00324 
00325             delete[] Blocks1;
00326 
00327             return;
00328         }
00329 
00330         sort_run(Blocks2, pos);
00331 
00332         cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00333         run.resize(cur_run_size);
00334         bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00335                        trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00336                        trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00337                        );
00338 
00339         for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00340         {
00341             run[i].value = Blocks2[i][0];
00342             write_reqs[i]->wait();
00343             write_reqs[i] = Blocks2[i].write(run[i].bid);
00344         }
00345         assert((pos % el_in_run) == 0);
00346 
00347         result_.runs.push_back(run);
00348         result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00349 
00350         while (!input.empty())
00351         {
00352             pos = 0;
00353             while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00354             {
00355                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00356                 ++input;
00357                 ++pos;
00358             }
00359             result_.elements += pos;
00360             sort_run(Blocks1, pos);
00361             cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00362             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00363             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00364                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00365                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00366                            );
00367 
00368             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00369 
00370             // fill the rest of the last block with max values (occurs only on the last run)
00371             for ( ; pos != el_in_run; ++pos)
00372                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00373 
00374 
00375             for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00376             {
00377                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00378                 write_reqs[i]->wait();
00379                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00380             }
00381             result_.runs.push_back(run); // #
00382 
00383             std::swap(Blocks1, Blocks2);
00384         }
00385 
00386         wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + m2);
00387         delete[] write_reqs;
00388         delete[] ((Blocks1 < Blocks2) ? Blocks1 : Blocks2);
00389     }
00390 
00391 
00399     template <class ValueType_>
00400     struct use_push
00401     {
00402         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00403     };
00404 
00416     template <
00417         class ValueType_,
00418         class Cmp_,
00419         unsigned BlockSize_,
00420         class AllocStr_>
00421     class runs_creator<
00422         use_push<ValueType_>,
00423         Cmp_,
00424         BlockSize_,
00425         AllocStr_>
00426     {
00427         Cmp_ cmp;
00428 
00429     public:
00430         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00431         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00432         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00433         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00434         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00435         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00436 
00437     private:
00438         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00439         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00440         unsigned_type m_;         // memory for internal use in blocks
00441 
00442         bool output_requested;    // true after the result() method was called for the first time
00443 
00444         const unsigned_type m2;
00445         const unsigned_type el_in_run;
00446         unsigned_type cur_el;
00447         block_type * Blocks1;
00448         block_type * Blocks2;
00449         request_ptr * write_reqs;
00450         run_type run;
00451 
00452         void sort_run(block_type * run, unsigned_type elements)
00453         {
00454             if (block_type::has_filler)
00455                 std::sort(
00456 #if 1
00457                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00458                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00459                         >(run, 0),
00460                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00461                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00462                         >(run, elements),
00463 #else
00464                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00465                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00466                         >(run, 0),
00467                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00468                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00469                         >(run, elements),
00470 #endif
00471                     cmp);
00472 
00473             else
00474                 std::sort(run[0].elem, run[0].elem + elements, cmp);
00475         }
00476         void finish_result()
00477         {
00478             if (cur_el == 0)
00479                 return;
00480 
00481 
00482             unsigned_type cur_el_reg = cur_el;
00483             sort_run(Blocks1, cur_el_reg);
00484             result_.elements += cur_el_reg;
00485             if (cur_el_reg < unsigned_type(block_type::size) &&
00486                 unsigned_type(result_.elements) == cur_el_reg)         // small input, do not flush it on the disk(s)
00487             {
00488                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator(use_push): Small input optimization, input length: " << cur_el_reg);
00489                 result_.small_.resize(cur_el_reg);
00490                 std::copy(Blocks1[0].begin(), Blocks1[0].begin() + cur_el_reg, result_.small_.begin());
00491                 return;
00492             }
00493 
00494             const unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(cur_el_reg, block_type::size);     // in blocks
00495             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00496             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00497             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00498                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00499                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00500                            );
00501 
00502             disk_queues::get_instance()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00503 
00504             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(cur_el_reg);
00505 
00506             // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00507             for ( ; cur_el_reg != el_in_run; ++cur_el_reg)
00508                 Blocks1[cur_el_reg / block_type::size][cur_el_reg % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00509 
00510 
00511             unsigned_type i = 0;
00512             for ( ; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00513             {
00514                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00515                 if (write_reqs[i].get())
00516                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00517 
00518                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00519             }
00520             result_.runs.push_back(run);
00521 
00522             for (i = 0; i < m2; ++i)
00523                 if (write_reqs[i].get())
00524                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00525         }
00526         void cleanup()
00527         {
00528             delete[] write_reqs;
00529             delete[] ((Blocks1 < Blocks2) ? Blocks1 : Blocks2);
00530             write_reqs = NULL;
00531             Blocks1 = Blocks2 = NULL;
00532         }
00533 
00534     public:
00538         runs_creator(Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00539             cmp(c), m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()), output_requested(false),
00540             m2(m_ / 2),
00541             el_in_run(m2 * block_type::size),
00542             cur_el(0),
00543             Blocks1(new block_type[m2 * 2]),
00544             Blocks2(Blocks1 + m2),
00545             write_reqs(new request_ptr[m2])
00546         {
00547             assert(2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00548         }
00549 
00550         ~runs_creator()
00551         {
00552             if (!output_requested)
00553                 cleanup();
00554         }
00555 
00558         void push(const value_type & val)
00559         {
00560             assert(output_requested == false);
00561             unsigned_type cur_el_reg = cur_el;
00562             if (cur_el_reg < el_in_run)
00563             {
00564                 Blocks1[cur_el_reg / block_type::size][cur_el_reg % block_type::size] = val;
00565                 ++cur_el;
00566                 return;
00567             }
00568 
00569             assert(el_in_run == cur_el);
00570             cur_el = 0;
00571 
00572             //sort and store Blocks1
00573             sort_run(Blocks1, el_in_run);
00574             result_.elements += el_in_run;
00575 
00576             const unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(el_in_run, block_type::size);    // in blocks
00577             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00578             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00579             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00580                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.begin()),
00581                            trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(run.end())
00582                            );
00583 
00584             disk_queues::get_instance()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00585 
00586             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(el_in_run);
00587 
00588             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00589             {
00590                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00591                 if (write_reqs[i].get())
00592                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00593 
00594                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00595             }
00596 
00597             result_.runs.push_back(run);
00598 
00599             std::swap(Blocks1, Blocks2);
00600 
00601             push(val);
00602         }
00603 
00607         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00608         {
00609             if (!output_requested)
00610             {
00611                 finish_result();
00612                 output_requested = true;
00613                 cleanup();
00614 #ifdef STXXL_PRINT_STAT_AFTER_RF
00615                 STXXL_MSG(*stats::get_instance());
00616 #endif
00617             }
00618             return result_;
00619         }
00620     };
00621 
00622 
00629     template <class ValueType_>
00630     struct from_sorted_sequences
00631     {
00632         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00633     };
00634 
00646     template <
00647         class ValueType_,
00648         class Cmp_,
00649         unsigned BlockSize_,
00650         class AllocStr_>
00651     class runs_creator<
00652         from_sorted_sequences<ValueType_>,
00653         Cmp_,
00654         BlockSize_,
00655         AllocStr_>
00656     {
00657         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00658         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00659         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00660         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00661         typedef AllocStr_ alloc_strategy_type;
00662         Cmp_ cmp;
00663 
00664     public:
00665         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00666         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00667 
00668     private:
00669         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00670         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00671         unsigned_type m_;         // memory for internal use in blocks
00672         buffered_writer<block_type> writer;
00673         block_type * cur_block;
00674         unsigned_type offset;
00675         unsigned_type iblock;
00676         unsigned_type irun;
00677         alloc_strategy_type alloc_strategy;
00678 
00679     public:
00684         runs_creator(Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00685             cmp(c),
00686             m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()),
00687             writer(m_, m_ / 2),
00688             cur_block(writer.get_free_block()),
00689             offset(0),
00690             iblock(0),
00691             irun(0)
00692         {
00693             assert(2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00694         }
00695 
00698         void push(const value_type & val)
00699         {
00700             assert(offset < block_type::size);
00701 
00702             (*cur_block)[offset] = val;
00703             ++offset;
00704 
00705             if (offset == block_type::size)
00706             {
00707                 // write current block
00708 
00709                 block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00710                 // allocate space for the block
00711                 result_.runs.resize(irun + 1);
00712                 result_.runs[irun].resize(iblock + 1);
00713                 bm->new_blocks(
00714                     offset_allocator<alloc_strategy_type>(iblock, alloc_strategy),
00715                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
00716                         result_.runs[irun].begin() + iblock),
00717                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
00718                         result_.runs[irun].end())
00719                     );
00720 
00721                 result_.runs[irun][iblock].value = (*cur_block)[0];         // init trigger
00722                 cur_block = writer.write(cur_block, result_.runs[irun][iblock].bid);
00723                 ++iblock;
00724 
00725                 offset = 0;
00726             }
00727 
00728             ++result_.elements;
00729         }
00730 
00732         void finish()
00733         {
00734             if (offset == 0 && iblock == 0) // current run is empty
00735                 return;
00736 
00737 
00738             result_.runs_sizes.resize(irun + 1);
00739             result_.runs_sizes.back() = iblock * block_type::size + offset;
00740 
00741             if (offset)    // if current block is partially filled
00742             {
00743                 while (offset != block_type::size)
00744                 {
00745                     (*cur_block)[offset] = cmp.max_value();
00746                     ++offset;
00747                 }
00748                 offset = 0;
00749 
00750                 block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00751                 // allocate space for the block
00752                 result_.runs.resize(irun + 1);
00753                 result_.runs[irun].resize(iblock + 1);
00754                 bm->new_blocks(
00755                     offset_allocator<alloc_strategy_type>(iblock, alloc_strategy),
00756                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
00757                         result_.runs[irun].begin() + iblock),
00758                     trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
00759                         result_.runs[irun].end())
00760                     );
00761 
00762                 result_.runs[irun][iblock].value = (*cur_block)[0];         // init trigger
00763                 cur_block = writer.write(cur_block, result_.runs[irun][iblock].bid);
00764             }
00765             else
00766             { }
00767 
00768             iblock = 0;
00769             ++irun;
00770         }
00771 
00775         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00776         {
00777             finish();
00778             writer.flush();
00779 
00780             return result_;
00781         }
00782     };
00783 
00784 
00789     template <class RunsType_, class Cmp_>
00790     bool check_sorted_runs(RunsType_ & sruns, Cmp_ cmp)
00791     {
00792         typedef typename RunsType_::block_type block_type;
00793         typedef typename block_type::value_type value_type;
00794         STXXL_VERBOSE2("Elements: " << sruns.elements);
00795         unsigned_type nruns = sruns.runs.size();
00796         STXXL_VERBOSE2("Runs: " << nruns);
00797         unsigned_type irun = 0;
00798         for (irun = 0; irun < nruns; ++irun)
00799         {
00800             const unsigned_type nblocks = sruns.runs[irun].size();
00801             block_type * blocks = new block_type[nblocks];
00802             request_ptr * reqs = new request_ptr[nblocks];
00803             for (unsigned_type j = 0; j < nblocks; ++j)
00804             {
00805                 reqs[j] = blocks[j].read(sruns.runs[irun][j].bid);
00806             }
00807             wait_all(reqs, reqs + nblocks);
00808             for (unsigned_type j = 0; j < nblocks; ++j)
00809             {
00810                 if (cmp(blocks[j][0], sruns.runs[irun][j].value) ||
00811                     cmp(sruns.runs[irun][j].value, blocks[j][0])) 
00812                 {
00813                     STXXL_ERRMSG("check_sorted_runs  wrong trigger in the run");
00814                     return false;
00815                 }
00816             }
00817             if (!stxxl::is_sorted(
00818 #if 1
00819                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00820                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00821                         >(blocks, 0),
00822                     ArrayOfSequencesIterator<
00823                         block_type, typename block_type::value_type, block_type::size
00824                         >(blocks, sruns.runs_sizes[irun]),
00825 #else
00826                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00827                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00828                         >(blocks, 0),
00829                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00830                         block_type, value_type, block_type::size
00831                         >(blocks,
00832                           //nblocks*block_type::size
00833                           //(irun<nruns-1)?(nblocks*block_type::size): (sruns.elements%(nblocks*block_type::size))
00834                           sruns.runs_sizes[irun]
00835                           ),
00836 #endif
00837                     cmp))
00838             {
00839                 STXXL_ERRMSG("check_sorted_runs  wrong order in the run");
00840                 return false;
00841             }
00842 
00843             delete[] reqs;
00844             delete[] blocks;
00845         }
00846 
00847         STXXL_MSG("Checking runs finished successfully");
00848 
00849         return true;
00850     }
00851 
00852 
00860     template <class RunsType_,
00861               class Cmp_,
00862               class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY>
00863     class runs_merger : private noncopyable
00864     {
00865         typedef RunsType_ sorted_runs_type;
00866         typedef AllocStr_ alloc_strategy;
00867         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::size_type size_type;
00868         typedef Cmp_ value_cmp;
00869         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00870         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::block_type block_type;
00871         typedef typename block_type::bid_type bid_type;
00872         typedef block_prefetcher<block_type, typename run_type::iterator> prefetcher_type;
00873         typedef run_cursor2<block_type, prefetcher_type> run_cursor_type;
00874         typedef sort_local::run_cursor2_cmp<block_type, prefetcher_type, value_cmp> run_cursor2_cmp_type;
00875         typedef loser_tree<run_cursor_type, run_cursor2_cmp_type, block_type::size> loser_tree_type;
00876 
00877         typedef stxxl::int64 diff_type;
00878         typedef std::pair<typename block_type::iterator, typename block_type::iterator> sequence;
00879         typedef typename std::vector<sequence>::size_type seqs_size_type;
00880         std::vector<sequence> * seqs;
00881         std::vector<block_type *> * buffers;
00882 
00883 
00884         sorted_runs_type sruns;
00885         unsigned_type m_; //  blocks to use - 1
00886         value_cmp cmp;
00887         size_type elements_remaining;
00888         unsigned_type buffer_pos;
00889         block_type * current_block;
00890         run_type consume_seq;
00891         prefetcher_type * prefetcher;
00892         loser_tree_type * losers;
00893         int_type * prefetch_seq;
00894         unsigned_type nruns;
00895 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
00896         typename block_type::value_type last_element;
00897 #endif
00898 
00899         void merge_recursively();
00900 
00901         void deallocate_prefetcher()
00902         {
00903             if (prefetcher)
00904             {
00905                 delete losers;
00906                 delete seqs;
00907                 delete buffers;
00908                 delete prefetcher;
00909                 delete[] prefetch_seq;
00910                 prefetcher = NULL;
00911             }
00912             // free blocks in runs , (or the user should do it?)
00913             sruns.deallocate_blocks();
00914         }
00915 
00916         void initialize_current_block()
00917         {
00918 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00919 
00920 // begin of STL-style merging
00921 
00922             //taks: merge
00923 
00924             if (!stxxl::SETTINGS::native_merge && mcstl::HEURISTIC::num_threads >= 1)
00925             {
00926                 seqs = new std::vector<sequence>(nruns);
00927                 buffers = new std::vector<block_type *>(nruns);
00928 
00929                 for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < nruns; i++)                                       //initialize sequences
00930                 {
00931                     (*buffers)[i] = prefetcher->pull_block();                                   //get first block of each run
00932                     (*seqs)[i] = std::make_pair((*buffers)[i]->begin(), (*buffers)[i]->end());  //this memory location stays the same, only the data is exchanged
00933                 }
00934 
00935 // end of STL-style merging
00936             }
00937             else
00938             {
00939 #endif
00940 
00941 // begin of native merging procedure
00942 
00943             losers = new loser_tree_type(prefetcher, nruns, run_cursor2_cmp_type(cmp));
00944 
00945 // end of native merging procedure
00946 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00947         }
00948 #endif
00949         }
00950 
00951         void fill_current_block()
00952         {
00953 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00954 
00955 // begin of STL-style merging
00956 
00957             //taks: merge
00958 
00959             if (!stxxl::SETTINGS::native_merge && mcstl::HEURISTIC::num_threads >= 1)
00960             {
00961  #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
00962                 value_type last_elem;
00963  #endif
00964 
00965                 diff_type rest = block_type::size;              // elements still to merge for this output block
00966 
00967                 do                                              // while rest > 0 and still elements available
00968                 {
00969                     value_type * min_last_element = NULL;       // no element found yet
00970                     diff_type total_size = 0;
00971 
00972                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
00973                     {
00974                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)
00975                             continue; //run empty
00976 
00977                         if (min_last_element == NULL)
00978                             min_last_element = &(*((*seqs)[i].second - 1));
00979                         else
00980                             min_last_element = cmp(*min_last_element, *((*seqs)[i].second - 1)) ? min_last_element : &(*((*seqs)[i].second - 1));
00981 
00982                         total_size += (*seqs)[i].second - (*seqs)[i].first;
00983                         STXXL_VERBOSE1("last " << *((*seqs)[i].second - 1) << " block size " << ((*seqs)[i].second - (*seqs)[i].first));
00984                     }
00985 
00986                     assert(min_last_element != NULL);           //there must be some element
00987 
00988                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("min_last_element " << min_last_element << " total size " << total_size + (block_type::size - rest));
00989 
00990                     diff_type less_equal_than_min_last = 0;
00991                     //locate this element in all sequences
00992                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
00993                     {
00994                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)
00995                             continue; //empty subsequence
00996 
00997                         typename block_type::iterator position = std::upper_bound((*seqs)[i].first, (*seqs)[i].second, *min_last_element, cmp);
00998                         STXXL_VERBOSE1("greater equal than " << position - (*seqs)[i].first);
00999                         less_equal_than_min_last += position - (*seqs)[i].first;
01000                     }
01001 
01002                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("finished loop");
01003 
01004                     ptrdiff_t output_size = (std::min)(less_equal_than_min_last, rest);   // at most rest elements
01005 
01006                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("before merge" << output_size);
01007 
01008                     mcstl::multiway_merge((*seqs).begin(), (*seqs).end(), current_block->end() - rest, cmp, output_size, false);
01009                     //sequence iterators are progressed appropriately
01010 
01011                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("after merge");
01012 
01013                     rest -= output_size;
01014 
01015                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("so long");
01016 
01017                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
01018                     {
01019                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)                        // run empty
01020                         {
01021                             if (prefetcher->block_consumed((*buffers)[i]))
01022                             {
01023                                 (*seqs)[i].first = (*buffers)[i]->begin();                // reset iterator
01024                                 (*seqs)[i].second = (*buffers)[i]->end();
01025                                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("block ran empty " << i);
01026                             }
01027                             else
01028                             {
01029                                 (*seqs).erase((*seqs).begin() + i);                       // remove this sequence
01030                                 (*buffers).erase((*buffers).begin() + i);
01031                                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("seq removed " << i);
01032                             }
01033                         }
01034                     }
01035                 } while (rest > 0 && (*seqs).size() > 0);
01036 
01037  #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01038                 if (!stxxl::is_sorted(current_block->begin(), current_block->end(), cmp))
01039                 {
01040                     for (value_type * i = current_block->begin() + 1; i != current_block->end(); i++)
01041                         if (cmp(*i, *(i - 1)))
01042                         {
01043                             STXXL_VERBOSE1("Error at position " << (i - current_block->begin()));
01044                         }
01045                     assert(false);
01046                 }
01047 
01048 
01049  #endif
01050 
01051 
01052 // end of STL-style merging
01053             }
01054             else
01055             {
01056 #endif
01057 
01058 // begin of native merging procedure
01059 
01060             losers->multi_merge(current_block->elem);
01061 
01062 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
01063 // end of native merging procedure
01064         }
01065 #endif
01066         }
01067 
01068     public:
01070         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::value_type value_type;
01071 
01076         runs_merger(const sorted_runs_type & r, value_cmp c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
01077             sruns(r), m_(memory_to_use / block_type::raw_size / sort_memory_usage_factor() /* - 1 */), cmp(c),
01078             elements_remaining(r.elements),
01079             current_block(NULL),
01080             prefetcher(NULL)
01081 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01082             , last_element(cmp.min_value())
01083 #endif
01084         {
01085             if (empty())
01086                 return;
01087 
01088 
01089             if (!sruns.small_.empty()) // we have a small input < B,
01090             // that is kept in the main memory
01091             {
01092                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_merger: small input optimization, input length: " << elements_remaining);
01093                 assert(elements_remaining == size_type(sruns.small_.size()));
01094                 current_block = new block_type;
01095                 std::copy(sruns.small_.begin(), sruns.small_.end(), current_block->begin());
01096                 current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01097                 buffer_pos = 1;
01098 
01099                 return;
01100             }
01101 
01102 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01103             assert(check_sorted_runs(r, cmp));
01104 #endif
01105 
01106             current_block = new block_type;
01107 
01108             disk_queues::get_instance()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
01109 
01110             nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01111 
01112             if (m_ < nruns)
01113             {
01114                 // can not merge runs in one pass
01115                 // merge recursively:
01116                 STXXL_ERRMSG("The implementation of sort requires more than one merge pass, therefore for a better");
01117                 STXXL_ERRMSG("efficiency decrease block size of run storage (a parameter of the run_creator)");
01118                 STXXL_ERRMSG("or increase the amount memory dedicated to the merger.");
01119                 STXXL_ERRMSG("m = " << m_ << " nruns=" << nruns);
01120 
01121                 // insufficient memory, can not merge at all
01122                 if (m_ < 2) {
01123                     STXXL_ERRMSG("The merger requires memory to store at least two blocks internally. Aborting.");
01124                     abort();
01125                 }
01126 
01127                 merge_recursively();
01128 
01129                 nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01130             }
01131 
01132             assert(nruns <= m_);
01133 
01134             unsigned_type i;
01135             /*
01136                const unsigned_type out_run_size =
01137                   div_and_round_up(elements_remaining,size_type(block_type::size));
01138              */
01139             unsigned_type prefetch_seq_size = 0;
01140             for (i = 0; i < nruns; i++)
01141             {
01142                 prefetch_seq_size += sruns.runs[i].size();
01143             }
01144 
01145             consume_seq.resize(prefetch_seq_size);
01146 
01147             prefetch_seq = new int_type[prefetch_seq_size];
01148 
01149             typename run_type::iterator copy_start = consume_seq.begin();
01150             for (i = 0; i < nruns; i++)
01151             {
01152                 copy_start = std::copy(
01153                     sruns.runs[i].begin(),
01154                     sruns.runs[i].end(),
01155                     copy_start);
01156             }
01157 
01158             std::stable_sort(consume_seq.begin(), consume_seq.end(),
01159                              sort_local::trigger_entry_cmp<bid_type, value_type, value_cmp>(cmp));
01160 
01161             int_type disks_number = config::get_instance()->disks_number();
01162 
01163             const int_type n_prefetch_buffers = STXXL_MAX(2 * disks_number, (int_type(m_) - int_type(nruns)));
01164 
01165 
01166 #ifdef SORT_OPTIMAL_PREFETCHING
01167             // heuristic
01168             const int_type n_opt_prefetch_buffers = 2 * disks_number + (3 * (n_prefetch_buffers - 2 * disks_number)) / 10;
01169 
01170             compute_prefetch_schedule(
01171                 consume_seq,
01172                 prefetch_seq,
01173                 n_opt_prefetch_buffers,
01174                 disks_number);
01175 #else
01176             for (i = 0; i < prefetch_seq_size; ++i)
01177                 prefetch_seq[i] = i;
01178 
01179 #endif
01180 
01181 
01182             prefetcher = new prefetcher_type(
01183                 consume_seq.begin(),
01184                 consume_seq.end(),
01185                 prefetch_seq,
01186                 nruns + n_prefetch_buffers);
01187 
01188             losers = NULL;
01189             seqs = NULL;
01190             buffers = NULL;
01191 
01192             initialize_current_block();
01193             fill_current_block();
01194 
01195 
01196             current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01197             buffer_pos = 1;
01198 
01199             if (elements_remaining <= block_type::size)
01200                 deallocate_prefetcher();
01201         }
01202 
01204         bool empty() const
01205         {
01206             return elements_remaining == 0;
01207         }
01209         runs_merger & operator ++ () // preincrement operator
01210         {
01211             assert(!empty());
01212 
01213             --elements_remaining;
01214 
01215             if (buffer_pos != block_type::size)
01216             {
01217                 current_value = current_block->elem[buffer_pos];
01218                 ++buffer_pos;
01219             }
01220             else
01221             {
01222                 if (!empty())
01223                 {
01224                     fill_current_block();
01225 
01226 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01227                     assert(stxxl::is_sorted(current_block->elem, current_block->elem + current_block->size, cmp));
01228                     assert(!cmp(current_block->elem[0], current_value));
01229 #endif
01230                     current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01231                     buffer_pos = 1;
01232                 }
01233                 if (elements_remaining <= block_type::size)
01234                     deallocate_prefetcher();
01235             }
01236 
01237 
01238 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01239             if (!empty())
01240             {
01241                 assert(!cmp(current_value, last_element));
01242                 last_element = current_value;
01243             }
01244 #endif
01245 
01246             return *this;
01247         }
01249         const value_type & operator * () const
01250         {
01251             assert(!empty());
01252             return current_value;
01253         }
01254 
01256         const value_type * operator -> () const
01257         {
01258             assert(!empty());
01259             return &current_value;
01260         }
01261 
01262 
01265         virtual ~runs_merger()
01266         {
01267             deallocate_prefetcher();
01268 
01269             if (current_block)
01270                 delete current_block;
01271 
01272             // free blocks in runs , (or the user should do it?)
01273             sruns.deallocate_blocks();
01274         }
01275 
01276     private:
01277         // cache for the current value
01278         value_type current_value;
01279     };
01280 
01281 
01282     template <class RunsType_, class Cmp_, class AllocStr_>
01283     void runs_merger<RunsType_, Cmp_, AllocStr_>::merge_recursively()
01284     {
01285         block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
01286         unsigned_type ndisks = config::get_instance()->disks_number();
01287         unsigned_type nwrite_buffers = 2 * ndisks;
01288 
01289         unsigned_type nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01290         const unsigned_type merge_factor =
01291             static_cast<unsigned_type>(ceil(pow(nruns, 1. / ceil(log(double(nruns)) / log(double(m_))))));
01292         assert(merge_factor <= m_);
01293         while (nruns > m_)
01294         {
01295             unsigned_type new_nruns = div_and_round_up(nruns, merge_factor);
01296             STXXL_VERBOSE("Starting new merge phase: nruns: " << nruns <<
01297                           " opt_merge_factor: " << merge_factor << " m:" << m_ << " new_nruns: " << new_nruns);
01298 
01299             sorted_runs_type new_runs;
01300             new_runs.runs.resize(new_nruns);
01301             new_runs.runs_sizes.resize(new_nruns);
01302             new_runs.elements = sruns.elements;
01303 
01304             unsigned_type runs_left = nruns;
01305             unsigned_type cur_out_run = 0;
01306             unsigned_type elements_in_new_run = 0;
01307             //unsigned_type blocks_in_new_run = 0;
01308 
01309 
01310             while (runs_left > 0)
01311             {
01312                 int_type runs2merge = STXXL_MIN(runs_left, merge_factor);
01313                 //blocks_in_new_run = 0 ;
01314                 elements_in_new_run = 0;
01315                 for (unsigned_type i = nruns - runs_left; i < (nruns - runs_left + runs2merge); ++i)
01316                 {
01317                     elements_in_new_run += sruns.runs_sizes[i];
01318                     //blocks_in_new_run += sruns.runs[i].size();
01319                 }
01320                 const unsigned_type blocks_in_new_run1 = div_and_round_up(elements_in_new_run, block_type::size);
01321                 //assert(blocks_in_new_run1 == blocks_in_new_run);
01322 
01323                 new_runs.runs_sizes[cur_out_run] = elements_in_new_run;
01324                 // allocate run
01325                 new_runs.runs[cur_out_run++].resize(blocks_in_new_run1);
01326                 runs_left -= runs2merge;
01327             }
01328 
01329             // allocate blocks for the new runs
01330             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < new_runs.runs.size(); ++i)
01331                 bm->new_blocks(alloc_strategy(),
01332                                trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(new_runs.runs[i].begin()),
01333                                trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(new_runs.runs[i].end()));
01334 
01335 
01336             // merge all
01337             runs_left = nruns;
01338             cur_out_run = 0;
01339             size_type elements_left = sruns.elements;
01340 
01341             while (runs_left > 0)
01342             {
01343                 unsigned_type runs2merge = STXXL_MIN(runs_left, merge_factor);
01344                 STXXL_VERBOSE("Merging " << runs2merge << " runs");
01345 
01346                 sorted_runs_type cur_runs;
01347                 cur_runs.runs.resize(runs2merge);
01348                 cur_runs.runs_sizes.resize(runs2merge);
01349 
01350                 std::copy(sruns.runs.begin() + nruns - runs_left,
01351                           sruns.runs.begin() + nruns - runs_left + runs2merge,
01352                           cur_runs.runs.begin());
01353                 std::copy(sruns.runs_sizes.begin() + nruns - runs_left,
01354                           sruns.runs_sizes.begin() + nruns - runs_left + runs2merge,
01355                           cur_runs.runs_sizes.begin());
01356 
01357                 runs_left -= runs2merge;
01358                 /*
01359                    cur_runs.elements = (runs_left)?
01360                    (new_runs.runs[cur_out_run].size()*block_type::size):
01361                    (elements_left);
01362                  */
01363                 cur_runs.elements = new_runs.runs_sizes[cur_out_run];
01364                 elements_left -= cur_runs.elements;
01365 
01366                 if (runs2merge > 1)
01367                 {
01368                     runs_merger<RunsType_, Cmp_, AllocStr_> merger(cur_runs, cmp, m_ * block_type::raw_size);
01369 
01370                     {   // make sure everything is being destroyed in right time
01371                         buf_ostream<block_type, typename run_type::iterator> out(
01372                             new_runs.runs[cur_out_run].begin(),
01373                             nwrite_buffers);
01374 
01375                         size_type cnt = 0;
01376                         const size_type cnt_max = cur_runs.elements;
01377 
01378                         while (cnt != cnt_max)
01379                         {
01380                             *out = *merger;
01381                             if ((cnt % block_type::size) == 0) // have to write the trigger value
01382                                 new_runs.runs[cur_out_run][cnt / size_type(block_type::size)].value = *merger;
01383 
01384 
01385                             ++cnt;
01386                             ++out;
01387                             ++merger;
01388                         }
01389                         assert(merger.empty());
01390 
01391                         while (cnt % block_type::size)
01392                         {
01393                             *out = cmp.max_value();
01394                             ++out;
01395                             ++cnt;
01396                         }
01397                     }
01398                 }
01399                 else
01400                 {
01401                     bm->delete_blocks(
01402                         trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
01403                             new_runs.runs.back().begin()),
01404                         trigger_entry_iterator<typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size>(
01405                             new_runs.runs.back().end()));
01406 
01407                     assert(cur_runs.runs.size() == 1);
01408 
01409                     std::copy(cur_runs.runs.front().begin(),
01410                               cur_runs.runs.front().end(),
01411                               new_runs.runs.back().begin());
01412                     new_runs.runs_sizes.back() = cur_runs.runs_sizes.back();
01413                 }
01414 
01415                 ++cur_out_run;
01416             }
01417             assert(elements_left == 0);
01418 
01419             nruns = new_nruns;
01420             sruns = new_runs;
01421         }
01422     }
01423 
01424 
01433     template <class Input_,
01434               class Cmp_,
01435               unsigned BlockSize_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(typename Input_::value_type),
01436               class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY>
01437     class sort : public noncopyable
01438     {
01439         typedef runs_creator<Input_, Cmp_, BlockSize_, AllocStr_> runs_creator_type;
01440         typedef typename runs_creator_type::sorted_runs_type sorted_runs_type;
01441         typedef runs_merger<sorted_runs_type, Cmp_, AllocStr_> runs_merger_type;
01442 
01443         runs_creator_type creator;
01444         runs_merger_type merger;
01445 
01446     public:
01448         typedef typename Input_::value_type value_type;
01449 
01454         sort(Input_ & in, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
01455             creator(in, c, memory_to_use),
01456             merger(creator.result(), c, memory_to_use)
01457         { }
01458 
01464         sort(Input_ & in, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use_rc, unsigned_type memory_to_use_m) :
01465             creator(in, c, memory_to_use_rc),
01466             merger(creator.result(), c, memory_to_use_m)
01467         { }
01468 
01469 
01471         const value_type & operator * () const
01472         {
01473             assert(!empty());
01474             return *merger;
01475         }
01476 
01477         const value_type * operator -> () const
01478         {
01479             assert(!empty());
01480             return merger.operator ->();
01481         }
01482 
01484         sort & operator ++ ()
01485         {
01486             ++merger;
01487             return *this;
01488         }
01489 
01491         bool empty() const
01492         {
01493             return merger.empty();
01494         }
01495     };
01496 
01502     template <
01503         class ValueType_,
01504         unsigned BlockSize_>
01505     class compute_sorted_runs_type
01506     {
01507         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
01508         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
01509         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
01510 
01511     public:
01512         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> result;
01513     };
01514 
01516 }
01517 
01520 
01522 
01531 template <unsigned BlockSize,
01532           class RandomAccessIterator,
01533           class CmpType,
01534           class AllocStr>
01535 void sort(RandomAccessIterator begin,
01536           RandomAccessIterator end,
01537           CmpType cmp,
01538           unsigned_type MemSize,
01539           AllocStr AS)
01540 {
01541     UNUSED(AS);
01542 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
01543     typedef typename streamify_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::stream_type InputType;
01544 #else
01545     typedef __typeof__(stream::streamify(begin, end)) InputType;
01546 #endif
01547     InputType Input(begin, end);
01548     typedef stream::sort<InputType, CmpType, BlockSize, AllocStr> sorter_type;
01549     sorter_type Sort(Input, cmp, MemSize);
01550     stream::materialize(Sort, begin);
01551 }
